intro: Schmidelia lasiostemon, commonly known as the velvetleaf schmidelia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Schmidelia lasiostemon is native to parts of Asia and is often found in temperate to subtropical regions.
